//gcode+mcode
"M00
Program stop, Non-optional—machine always stops on reaching M00 in the program execution.



" "M01
Optional program stop ,Machine only stops at M01 if operator pushes the optional stop button.



" "M02
End of program,execution may or may not return to program top (depending on the control)may or may not reset register values. M02 was the original program-end code, now considered obsolete, but still supported for backward compatibility. Many modern controls treat M02 as equivalent to M30. 



" "M03 Spindle start forward CW(Clockwise Rotation)



" "M04 Spindle start reverse CCW

n
" "M05 Spindle stop



" "M06 Tool change

n
" "M07 Coolant ON – Mist coolant/Coolant thru spindle



" "M08 Coolant ON – Flood coolant



" "M09 Coolant OFF



" "M19 Spindle orientation



" "M28 Return to origin



" "M29 Rigid tap

" "M30 End of program (Reset)



" "M41 Low gear select



" "M42 High gear select



" "M94 Cancel mirrorimage



" "M95 Mirrorimage of X axis



" "M96 Mirrorimage of Y axis



" "M98 Subprogram call



" "M99 End of subprogram



"
"G00
Move in a straight line at rapids speed.



" "G01
Move in a straight line at last speed commanded by a (F)eedrate XYZ of endpoint.



" "G02
Clockwise circular arc at (F)eedrate XYZ of endpoint IJK relative to center R for radius. 



" "G03
Counter-clockwise circular arc at (F)eedrate XYZ of endpoint IJK relative to center R for radius.



" "G04
Dwell: Stop for a specified time. P for milliseconds X for seconds.



" "G05
FADAL Non-Modal Rapids.



" "G09
Exact stop check.



" "G10
Programmable parameter input.



" "G15
Turn Polar Coordinates OFF, return to Cartesian Coordinates.



" "G16
Turn Polar Coordinates ON.



" "G17
Select X-Y plane.



" "G18
Select X-Z plane.



" "G19
Select Y-Z plane.



" "G20
Program coordinates are inches.



" "G21
Program coordinates are mm.



" "G27
Reference point return check.



" "G28
Return to home position.



" "G29
Return from the reference position.



" "G30
Return to the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th reference point.



" "G32
Constant lead threading (like G01 synchronized with spindle).



" "G40
Tool cutter compensation off (radius comp.).



" "G41
Tool cutter compensation left (radius comp.).



" "G42
Tool cutter compensation right (radius comp.).



" "G43
Apply tool length compensation (plus).



" "G44
Apply tool length compensation (minus).



" "G49
Tool length compensation cancel.



" "G50
Reset all scale factors to 1.0.



" "G51
Turn on scale factors.



" "G52
Local workshift for all coordinate systems: add XYZ offsets.



" "G53
Machine coordinate system (cancel work offsets).



" "G54
Work coordinate system (1st Workpiece).



" "G55
Work coordinate system (2st Workpiece).



" "G56
Work coordinate system (3st Workpiece).



" "G57
Work coordinate system (4st Workpiece).



" "G58
Work coordinate system (5st Workpiece).



" "G59
Work coordinate system (6st Workpiece).



" "G61
Exact stop check mode.



" "G62
Automatic corner override.



" "G63
Tapping mode.



" "G64
Best speed path.



" "G65
Custom macro simple call.



" "G68
Coordinate System Rotation.



" "G69
Cancel Coordinate System Rotation.



" "G73
High speed drilling cycle (small retract).



" "G74
Left hand tapping cycle.



" "G76
Fine boring cyle.



" "G80
Cancel canned cycle.



" "G81
Simple drilling cycle.



" "G82
Drilling cycle with dwell (counterboring).



" "G83
Peck drilling cycle (full retract).



" "G84
Tapping cycle.



" "G85
Boring canned cycle, no dwell, feed out.



" "G86
Boring canned cycle, spindle stop, rapid out.



" "G87
Back boring canned cycle.



" "G88
Boring canned cycle, spindle stop, manual out.



" "G89
Boring canned cycle, dwell, feed out.



" "G90
Absolute programming of XYZ (type B and C systems).



" "G90.1
Absolute programming IJK (type B and C systems).



" "G91
Incremental programming of XYZ (type B and C systems).



" "G91.1
Incremental programming IJK (type B and C systems).



" "G92
Offset coordinate system and save parameters.



" "G92(alternate)
Clamp of maximum spindle speed S.



" "G92.1
Cancel offset and zero parameters.



" "G92.2
Cancel offset and retain parameters.



" "G92.3
Offset coordinate system with saved parameters.



" "G94
Units per minute feed mode. Units in inches or mm..



" "G95
Units per revolution feed mode. Units in inches or mm.



" "G96
Constant surface speed.



" "G97
Cancel constant surface speed.



" "G98
Return to initial Z plane after canned cycle.



" "G99
Return to initial R plane after canned cycle.



"
//stock recommendation for TechnologyResult
BIG STOCK :

 -Can be clamped in a vice.

 -Can be clamped in two vices(check that the vices are on the same line !!!).

 -Use a table and clamps.

 -Can be clamped with asymmetric clamps.


SMALL STOCK :

 -Can be clamped in a vice.

 -Can be clamped in two vices (check that the vices are on the same line!!!).

 -Fix part with Hot glue

 -Fix the part with Double Coated Tape.

 -Fix the part on the table with clamps.


THIN-WIDE STOCK:

 -Vacuum board.

 -Hot glue.

 -Fix the part with Double Coated Tape.

 -Use a table and clamps.


THIN-NARROW STOCK:

 -Fix the part on the table with clamps.

 -Can be clamped in a vice.

 -Can be clamped in two vices (check that the pieces are on the same line!).

 -Hot glue.

 -Fix the part with Double Coated Tape.

 -Vacuum board.


CYLINDER STOCK:

 -In the footer

 -Set in a vice at three points.


// milling/drill/text/... recommendations
"SIDE MILLING :
 * Single mill for rough and finish job *

 1. Rough: Leave 0.2-0.5 mm offset for finish 
 2. Finish: It is recommended to increase RPM and decrease feed for better surface finish
 3. If a long cutter is required, reduce the speed and feed"
"SIDE MILLING :
 * Two mills rough and finish *

 1.Rough Mill: Leave 0.2-0.5 mm offset for finish(rough mill can operate at higher modes compared to a finish mill)
 2.Finish Mill: It is recommended to increase RPM and decrease feed for better surface finish(check the length of the cutting edge )
 3.Check number of teeth on your tool !""
"SLOT MILLING :
 * one cutter at once to the size of the slot *

 1.Cut material along a helical trajectory or along an acceptable step down in one direction
 2.Milling a slot with one cutter does not guarantee a good surface, but a small step down can be used to improve it.
 3. If a long cutter is required, reduce the speed and feed"
 4.3.Check number of teeth on your tool !
"SLOT MILLING :
 * One or Two mills rough and finish *

 1. Rough: Leave 0.2-0.5 mm offset for finish(this means that the mill must be a smaller diameter than the required slot size) Cut material along a helical trajectory or along an acceptable step down in one direction
 2. Finish: It is recommended to increase RPM and decrease feed for better surface finish
 3. If a long cutter is required, reduce the speed and feed"
"DRILL :
 * Drilling with HSS tool *

 1.Before drilling with HSS use Center Drill(pre-Drilling)
 2.Use peck for Hss Drill
"
"DRILL :
 * Use Solid Carbide Drill's *

 1.Without pre-Drilling
 2.Check cutting data for your Solid Carbide Drill
" M Code G CODE G / M CODE Gallery
